name: Nevada State Museum
address: 600 N Carson St, Carson City, NV 89701, USA
reviews: What an impressive museum!!  We spent much longer there than we initially intended. Lots of interesting information, and the mine area was so very impressive!!  You really get a taste of what it was like to work underground in a mine!! They are working on a new natural history area that should be quite spectacular too!! Don't pass it up!

I've been to lots of museums.  This by far has the greatest diversity of interesting & informative high quality displays.  From diverse geological, zoological, historic, numismatic, mining history, Mammoth skeleton, and so much more.  Allow 3 hours to breeze through.  This museum is a must see!

Fantastic collections.  They've restored one of the original coin mint machines and it is fascinating.  The weapons collection is extensive and really interesting.  Lots of old-west artifacts.  They have a top-notch curator.
If you’re anywhere near Reno go ride the steam locomotives! The ride there was nice also. The Wild mustangs we saw on the way back were worth the trip. Also close by is Virginia city. Cool stuff!

I stop here everytime I am in town as its quite cheap and very interesting place to spend a few hours! The guy up front is probably one of the nicest people you will meet, wish I got his name but I hope he knows how great he is!

I decided to get an annual pass this time around and I'm already counting down the days till I go back!

If you get a chance to stop by I highly recommend it!

name: Nevada State Railroad Museum
address: 2180 S Carson St, Carson City, NV 89701, USA
reviews: We went right before Christmas and took our 3-year old & our 10-month old. I believe the train that gave rides is one of only 2 or 3The trains are decorated for Christmas. Santa and his helper boarded and rode the train, which thrilled the children. Santa & helper gave candy canes to passengers. Inside the museum are refinished beautiful old steam engines. We will go again.
Not a huge place, but great display of probably the most historic moment in rails... The Golden Spike ceremony. Worth the trip if you like history.

Went for the Christmas Train Ride!  My whole family has a fantastic time especially our four grandkids!  The museum was amazing,  the train conductors told us wonderful stories about the old but beautiful trains,  and we had a lot of fun in the gift shop!  We had great time!  😄🚂💙
One of my favorites! I go back again and again. There's always somebody, a volunteer, who seems to know everything about everything. This time, we got a ride on an old-time hand car.
Excellent exhibits of railroad history and stock. Very friendly and knowledgeable staff. Thoroughly enjoyed this museum!!🙂

name: Kings Canyon Waterfalls
address: Kings Canyon Rd, Carson City, NV 89703, USA
reviews: Great waterfalls for the short hike! .3 of a mile to the lower falls gives you a great reward. It is uphill on you way to the falls, with switchbacks.

So close to town. Easy trail to the waterfall. Local trail enthusiasts and forest service collaborated to create an additional loop trail (waterfall trail is short spur off this loop trail). It takes hikers up one ridge, back down to creek above waterfall, then up along the opposite ridge and back down the the parking area. Really well laid out trail never gets too steep. About 1.8 miles total. Great views of Carson City and Westside hills. A must-do. Just follow King St west to the parking area.
Love coming up here late evening/dark when everyone else is gone, the waterfall under the moonlight is amazing.
When you get to the waterfall the free AC is nice

Very beautiful hike depending on the time of year. Definitely be aware if you’re taking the longer or shorter trail to the waterfall. The aroma of some of the plants is amazing. Quite an enjoyable, and at times, breathtaking (literally!) hike.

name: Nevada Governor Mansion
address: 606 Mountain St, Carson City, NV 89703, USA
reviews: We took a stroll in this beautiful, peaceful neighborhood and enjoyed the distinctive architectural details of this remarkable Mansion. The Governor personally hands out treats on Halloween. Also, the Nevada Room is available for use by nonprofit organizations, charitable community groups and schools.
Drove the block its on. Wow, flash back into the past.

The Governor's Mansion is absolutely stunning. It is open to the public only one day out of the year and that's on Nevada Day!  The tour is free and is given by people dressed in period clothing. You get to see all the rooms and learn about the history. I loved the silver place settings with the Nevada shaped napkins. The silverware even had little "N"s on them! They also do an amazing job of decorating the outside of the mansion during the holidays.
Love the Halloween spirit and goodies plus the added Highway Patrol, crash test dummies and others who support this annual event!
Dude!

name: Children's Museum of Northern Nevada
address: 813 N Carson St, Carson City, NV 89701, USA
reviews:
I took the my daycare kids to see the museum I haven't been for a long time and they loved it. However, I wish it was a little bit more interactive. You can keep the history part of the whole museum but add more in depth learning to it for all ages. Infants to teens will honestly want to know more and I feel like if there is more to do for the kids than more and more kids will want to come. 

We did have fun though! And the front desk ladies were super sweet!

This is a amazing placing for children under 10 years old.  The museum is got so much hands on AND it is parent friendly.  Very little bending over, lots of things that parent and child do together.

The price is near perfect and the activities and numerous.  

Plan to spend a couple of hours for sure. Also don't miss out on a chance to be an engineer driving a train.
My kids loved it. There was a ton of stuff to do. It seemed very clean and fairly cheap. Kids are 5 and 1-1/2

I don't know what I was expecting when I brought my daughter, but this wasn't it (i think i was expecting organized museum flow - like one display/exhibit flowing smoothly into another). But this was - - - Kids running everywhere, rickety building (that has it's own charm to be sure), a huge room with chaos and 'exhibits' seemingly everywhere... But once i was committed (10$?? 15$?) - it's actually pretty dang cool.  There's a little bit of something for everyone and it's very much a place for kids to explore new things.  There's music stations, nutrition stations, Nevada history stations, plus a whole bunch of other things.  I will definitely go back for a rainy day visit with my kid to explore more. It is also a venue option for kids birthday parties which I would also consider for the future.
Pretty cool spot to take your kids and avoid the summer nevada heat

name: Brewery Arts Center
address: 449 W King St, Carson City, NV 89703, USA
reviews: I love the historic building being turned into a place where hundreds of people can enjoy art
Great outside venue in Brewery Arts parking lot.

I attended two of the free outdoor summer music shows in 2019.  This is my only experience here.  While there we visited the buildings that were open and enjoyed the art.  The grounds were clean and nice.  I will now be keeping an eye out for events at the Carson City Brewery Arts Center.

Saw Mike Nash in a solo, unplugged sort of concert at the wonderful BAC venue. Simply fantastic. Mike Nash doesn't know it yet, but this solo format is the one at which he excels. I look forward to more "intimate evenings with Mike Nash". I applaud the BAC for helping to bring such wonderful evenings of entertainment to our lovely community.
Great place to see events! Plenty of space and usually great shows planned! This really does help grow the community closer.

name: Jack C Davis Observatory
address: 2269 Vanpatten Ave, Carson City, NV 89703, USA
reviews: They have a great program weekly and several telescopes to view celestial objects. When they have star parties you can bring your own equipment and there are outlets available to plug your equipment into. There is a walking path between the main campus and the observatory that has plaques with planets, and other objects.

If you live in the Carson valley area it's a must to visit 
I really enjoyed it !
Went to "Joan of Ark" lecture.  Was very interesting!  Learned a lot.  Great lecture!

Went for their star gazing party and the hosts were very knowledgable and were more than willing to share about what you can see. If you have a someone who wants to study the sky. Bring them, these guys may inspire more than  you think
We had an amazing experience and learned many new things. The volunteers are very patient and enjoy sharing their knowledge. We will definitely be back!

name: Fuji Park
address: 601 Old Clear Creek Rd, Carson City, NV 89701, USA
reviews: This is a nice park. It has a fun climbing structure and picnic tables in the sun and shade. There's a huge lawn for running around too. The bathrooms are usually pretty clean. My only complaint is that sometimes they're out of soap.
Wonderful park! Great for children. And a big grass field for a nice picnic.
State Fair in the state capitol what more could you say it's a fair fairs are always cool
The people were so helpful and very pleasant to be around

I take the dogs to the park, they have a fenced area for the large and an area for the small dogs which they can be off leash, also the park allows dogs, but on a leash. The park also has a lot of events, fun to check them out. Nice place

name: Mills Park
address: 1111 E William St, Carson City, NV 89701, USA
reviews: The train ride here is always a blast for the kids when you can catch it open, and the park is very beautiful. A big creek runs through it with awesome little bridges. I'd mark it 5 stars bit it is very urban.
I love Mills Park during the day for walking. There are homeless people who hang out here ...very few during the day though. It's a nice place to spend your lunch break.
Been going here since a kid and now my kid goes here. I love the park but it could use a clean up crew some time soon!

A great place to visit if you're in the heart of Carson City. Often has public events like the travelling Faire. Volleyball pits and skate park, jungle gym for the kids. Peaceful in the evening for a stroll or tossing horseshoes. Can get a bit dicey after dark because of rampant hordes of local vagrants, so best clear out before dusk.

It's a nice little area to go relax with friends and family. There are picnic tables in both the sun and the shade, and they have enough space in between them that you won't be disturbed by other park-goers. Optimal place to go hang out for a small picnic/lunch (BYOFood. Lol)

name: Carson City Nugget
address: 507 N Carson St, Carson City, NV 89701, USA
reviews:
The staff are going well beyond at taking care of players. The cocktail waitresses are attentive and quite frankly, very beautiful.

They have a wide variety of slot machines and table games including Keno. They have many promotionalevents throughout the year and every amenity for the card club player.

Their security is very watchful over the patrons and polite. Parking is plentiful and secure.

They have restaurants and a wine bar, along with two more bars on the casino floor. On weekends live bands play and no cover charge.
Nice cafe offerings for the price - they've kept the practices of the traditional casinos. Cozy atmosphere.
Angelinas, Food is always wonderful.  Nice quiet atmosphere.  Friendly staff.

Stoped in here on the way to Virginia City from Reno. Didn't expect to find a "Nugget" of a place in the middle of nowhere. This place for hanging out, gambling a bit or eating is really special. It might have been a real popular place back in the "good ole' days", but now, not many folks visit here.  All of the staff members we interacted with were great. Very pleasant and helpful folks. Casino is large enough to enjoy yourself, but not so big as to "get lost". The real special place here is the "eatery" located inside of the Nugget. There were six of us on this trip and we ate here multiple times over several days. Encountering different server staff each time, and each staff member made our visit very special. It really seemed like they enjoyed their job. The food was excellent and the prices were astonishingly inexpensive. We all agreed that we would come back here if just for the dinning experiences only. Excellent experiences. Would highly recommend and will certainly return.

Carson City Nugget is a lot of fun. Nice atmosphere. Lotta slots if that's your thing. $5 a hand blackjack on Wednesday nights (not sure about peak hours). Free drinks for players. My favorite in Carson City so far.

name: Washoe Lake State Park
address: 4855 Eastlake Blvd, New Washoe City, NV 89704, USA
reviews: There are a few hang gliding launches in the area and we land at the park. Washoe Lake State Park maintains a landing zone at the park which is really nice. Beautiful park and a good place to see wild horses. Great staff.
We had a great time during our visit to see our daughter in our son  In law. It is very pretty but also very cold during the 1st week of January. Can't wait to visit again.
This place is so beautiful! So much nature. I liked it:
Great time hiking out here!  Horse friendly.  Do you self a favor and hike the Deadman’s Overlook Trail.
Well maintained, only $5 to access all areas of the lake. We are bird watchers, and this is an incredible place to find all sorts of fauna.

name: Secret Cove
address: NV-28, Incline Village, NV 89451, USA
reviews: Super super nice hiding cove I have ever met. Definitely deserves to go back once and once again. I saw people bring paddle board or kayak but it’s very hard to carry heavy stuff since you need to use the hidden trail to get there. I assure you will love here but will feel exhausted to hand carry a lot tools. The water looks unbelievable I think it’s not worse than Hawaii. Again, the only difficulty is the path not so friendly for small kids. I believe that’s why there are not so many people crowded. It’s easy to find this place since you will see a lot of parking aside the road when you drive close. Finding a good parking location is important.

It's so beautiful here! The water is crystal clear with a unique shade of blue. Very gorgeous! Yes, it's a nude beach as well, so don't be surprised. It's not ideal for picnicking; we were swarmed by wasps as soon as we took our food out.
Secret can't stayed secret for long. But steep trails and small parking area are protecting this perfect creation of Mother Nature. Pristine views, magical rock formation and clear sky water!

Amazing place! Another great creation by the mother nature. You need to park up there on the road and then walk down. The water is so clear couldn’t even believe. Please keep that place cleaner than you found it.
Amazon Place unreal betautiful water. We went there in winter shielded from wind no people around. So nice.

name: Hang Gliding Tahoe
address: 2640 E College Pkwy, Carson City, NV 89706, USA
reviews: Best part of my trip to Lake Tahoe was the powered hang glider flight.  Paul did a great job as both pilot and tour guide.  The flight serves as a intro to flying lesson and he patiently answered all of my questions.   There's no better way to see Lake Tahoe.  I plan to do this again.
Paul is great.  Glad i went. Exhilerating.
Super fun

It was my first time experiencing Hang Gliding and Paul made the entire experience super exciting! I am ready to go again whenever I visit Tahoe! He even allowed us to steer and created moments for us to pause and smile at the camera throughout the flight! I highly recommend Hang Gliding Tahoe for a never forgettable Adventure with a spectacular view!!
Amazing! Paul is an awesome dude and I got everything I wanted and more. Scenic flight, instruction, Tahoe facts and more. Highly recommend.

name: American Warbirds
address: 2600 E College Pkwy # 33, Carson City, NV 89706, USA

name: Sand Harbor
address: 2005 NV-28, Incline Village, NV 89452, USA
reviews: Sand Harbor is one of the greatest places at Tahoe. The beach is great in the summer. My kids love exploring and playing on the huge rocks. It's pretty slammed most summer days, so you'll need to get there early to get a parking spot. It's excellent for an all-day outing. It's a good idea to bring some shade (a canopy or umbrella) and food if you plan on being there a while. Even in the winter this is a great place.

Have to get here early in order to park your vehicle within the park.  If not then a shuttle is offered from incline village to the park.  Has a bar and food in the park with plenty of restrooms.  Has lifeguards and a beautiful trail.  Highly recommend this beach.  Awesome place overall and in my opinion, the best beach in Tahoe.

How do you give a review on something that is naturally so beautiful! I had a great time here and enjoyed its beauty. I highly recommend this spot rather you ride, walk, run or are pushed. Have a great time with family and friends or just a walk with that special someone.
Enjoy!

Sand harbor is absolutely beautiful! It was my firdt time in Lake Tahoe and this was one of the must see places on our list.  My lady and I climbed the bolders, and took a half dip in the freezing cold water all while enjoying the awesome views of the snow capped mountains bleeding into the wide open glass like water. We also found tons of different types of precious stones in the sand by the water. It was a gorgeous day at Sand Harbor and will definitely be back in the summer!

Small beach, yet beautiful. There is paid parking lot. 

I went during December and the parking lot is closed (probably for all winter long). The harbor and beach is still accessible. You can either park at the beach parking lot and walk over or park further away and take the trail to get there.

name: Stewart Indian School Trail
address: Carson City, NV 89701, USA
reviews: The trail has an interactive map system. You call a number on your cell. Enter the simple code. And voices of actual former students speak of their experiences when the school was in operation. If you have the time. I'd recommend making this trip.
Lots of history here. While this area is also used for law enforcement training, it also holds a piece of what made Nevada's natives.
They seem to be off to a good start. Quite a bit of reference material, fairly decent timeline display. Informative.
There is a rich history behind this place.  Quaint.  We were there to attend a graduating class from the Police Academy.
Oh a very nice day for a pow wow on fathers day had a very nice time watching the dancing and the Indian tacos where fantastic , I highly recommend you take part in if you never had it well touch you

name: Chimney Beach
address: Carson City, NV 89703, USA
reviews:
Chimney is seriously one of the best places on Tahoe, although in recent years it's become quite popular. I guess the word's gotten out?  The trailhead is relatively hard to spot so really keep an eye out on the west side of 28 about a mile from the Carson City/Washoe line.  If you see the parking lot to Marlette Lake on the right, just look across the highway to a very faint trail leading into the woods. 

There's a reason why the Nevada shore is SO  much better than California's bawdy, built-up, touristy side. Most of the Nevada shoreline of Lake Tahoe is maintained as a wild, wilderness setting with only hike-in access to the water ... and that's exactly what you get here.  It's about a half-hour walk from the highway through deep woods to the beach so if you're carrying a floaty device it could take a bit.  My advice is to get here mid-week because on summer weekends it is impossible to find a spot on the beach and parking on the highway is spotty. Nevada troopers will leave a ticket on your windshield at certain spota. Five stars ... even with the all the skin on the beach. (Yes it is technically a nude beach.)
This beach is lovely!  It's a bit of a walk down the hill from the parking lot and parking can get really packed so go early or be prepared to find parking on the street.  But it's totally worth it.

Crystal clear waters are great for swimming, diving, and kayaking. Gets very crowded so be there early. There is limited parking and a hike down to the beach so don't carry a lot of things because it will be very exhausting on the way back up. One of the best beaches in Tahoe!
Totally missed the chimney, but I saw everything else! An amazing beachfront that undoubtedly gets busy on the weekends. I went midweek during the summer, and the crowds weren't that bad.

A Hidden Gem don't go to the place its  only for me and my husband..lol I'm just kidding this is a beautiful place if it's worth the half a mile walk down to it in the half-mile back up once you get there at the breathtaking with the cleanest water in the most beautiful rocks to perch on like a mermaid ..🐼🐼🐰🐇

name: Jackpot Crossing Casino
address: 1897 N Edmonds Dr, Carson City, NV 89701, USA
reviews: Small locals casino in Carson City. The staff was very friendly, ready to help when needed. This is a slot games only casino. However, it has a limited variety of games. Fun, comfortable and nice experience overall.
Fun place with friendly staff. Not to crowded
No gueno they don't given nothing

It is small but I have walked away ahead each time I've gone there! Friendly staff, great place I don't think there is a restaurant, drinks are free, no table games but a variety of slot games, of course they only use paper $$, I miss putting my coins in and cashing out and getting coins, those were the good times! Oh well give it s try  and GOOD LUCK!

The employees always remember me right down to the janitor, they say hello and make it a point to do so with all their customers.  You'll get a decent cocktail or you can serve yourself non alcoholic beverages when you get thirsty without waiting an hour for a waitress.  Love it!

name: Comstock Casino
address: 3680 Goni Rd # 1, Carson City, NV 89706, USA
reviews: Great food! Perfect service as well. Food is always hot and accurate to your order. Whenever my coworker and I are in the part of town.  We make sure to take a lunch break just to go to this spot!
Fun place and good food. I appreciate that the fountain machine is self severing or you can have someone get you a drink.

After moving to Carson City back in September, I received a "Welcome to the Neighborhood" flyer offering freeplay from Comstock Casino.  So I thought I would check it out, and I'm glad I did. Comstock is a quaint Casino, with an extremely helpful and friendly staff. Also, try the food. Really good.  I will return.
Comstock is local fabn favorite with a well earned reputation of quality gaming
Want, has the most awesome, Mexican restaurant. The fur kids we're sleeping past bed Time. 🐕🐕🐕

name: Riverview Park
address: 600 Marsh Rd, Carson City, NV 89701, USA
reviews: Love the trail system. You can also take the extension toward Silver Saddle Ranch that meanders behind the houses on Carson River Road, roughly parallel to Mexican Ditch. You can then hike all the way to Mexican Dam. I also love the river access and am looking forward to the restoration of the Empire extension of the trail from Riverview Park, which is closed as of this writing. Be aware of the possibility of coyotes. You may also see woodpeckers, ducks, geese, osprey and other raptors and even cows.
Great easy dirt trails barely any inclines. Great views and access to Carson River.
Great walking trails and views.  The trails link in with other trails to give you even more areas to walk.
Beautiful river scenery, peaceful setting..
Love the trail and river access, but the dogs picked up lots of goat heads in their paws.

name: Memorial Point Scenic Overlook
address: Tahoe Blvd, New Washoe City, NV 89704, USA
reviews: A breath-taking place to be. A must - stop to just sit on these rocks and enjoy the beauty of lake Tahoe. There is a hiking trail that goes a little way up around the lake (it's not that far, but prob a good 20min stroll, relax and enjoy the slow pace life!), sunbake on the huge rocks. A great place for kids to stretch their legs and scramble over mother nature.
Beautiful scenery but very crowded. There are spots along the trial that are just as lovely but peaceful.
Beautiful place to take an easy walk

Extremely scenic and beautiful. There is a trail across which you can walk and enjoy the scenic view. The parking here is valid for 20 mins only.
Definitely a must visit.

This is one of the many things about Lake Tahoe that has convinced me that I need to spend more time up there. This overlook is attached to a paved trail on the lake that can be accessed through several overlooks and bus stops.

name: Korean War Veterans Memorial Park
address: 600 Marsh Rd, Carson City, NV 89701, USA
reviews: Great trail for walking dogs n taking kids. Took our running stroller had no problems. Scenic n goes along river half way thru.
My dog loves it here, everyone is always nice and so are their dogs. Only have to watch for ticks in the summer
It is a wonderful walk.  Today was very windy though
Such a nice walk down to the river. I like to take my four-year-old son down here with his bicycle and sometimes the RC boat. Very nice flat walk great for disabled folks like myself
Great shaded parking, trail head for hiking and biking the area.

name: Sonoma Park
address: 1003 Sonoma St, Carson City, NV 89701, USA
reviews: My dog loves this place. Buddy loves to play with all the dogs every time we go. Definitely recommend this park to dog owners.

Sonoma Park is a delightful little neighborhood park, with a large, fenced dog park, and a smaller, but fully adequate fenced playground. The children's water fountain doesn't work (as of July 2019), but the dog waterer works great. The benches could use sanding and painting. The restroom is a port-a-potty. Bring your own water and something to sit on. Otherwise this is a wonderful little park to bring children to.

This dog park is nice and my dogs love it. 
It's more for bigger dog's than smaller dogs. But all dog's are welcome. 💕

Perhaps the biggest dog park in the country?  In addition there's a nice playground and enough not-dog-park to play catch and kick a ball around.  A few nice shade trees and everything there is well-manicured and in good repair.  A great neighborhood park.

Beautiful park.  Huge.  Lots of wide open green grass for running and playing.  Bring your own water, they shut off the fountain until Spring so that the pipes wouldn't freeze.  All fenced in.  Nice people.  Nice dogs.

name: Spooner Lake - Lake Tahoe Nevada State Park
address: Carson City, NV 89703, USA
reviews: Took the Lake Loop in January. The trail was a great 2.1 mile hike over easy terrain. We had a snowball fight along the way and enjoyed beautiful scenery. This is a must-see place!
Isolated lake is fabulous! Well off the beaten track. Escape for some solitude and earn your views. Gorgeous location and a must see
Perfect place for a winter hike and snowball fight.
Hiked the trail around the lake with snowshoes. Beautiful, peaceful, loved it.
Beautiful starting point for cross country skiing

name: Whale Beach
address: Carson City, NV 89703, USA
reviews: Great little hike, about 3.5 miles in and out.
Cute beach tucked away and quieter than the other beaches along this side of the lake. It’s a bit harder to get to, but worth it if you’re looking for a more secluded beach.
Great place to see the beauty of lake Tahoe, great spot for swimming too
Hand down the best beach with so much to explore.
Beautiful. I can't wait to bring my family and enjoy the beauty of nature. Water was extremely cold but so worth the experience.

name: John Mankins Park
address: Carson City, NV 89703, USA
reviews: Love taking our grandson to this park. It is well maintained, has very nice play equipment and there are ducks, geese and sea gulls to feed. If you go, and have a child, the firefighters at the fire station next door are often caring for their equipment so be sure and go by with your kids....they love showing off their trucks and equipment to kids.

This is a really nice park, good skate park, good playground equipment, baseball, basketball, tennis, huge grass field, long-ish sidewalk path great for teaching my kids to skate.  Very clean, good crowd.  Parking is hit and miss.  It's on a road that must be a popular cut through, because cars fly through there all day
Had a fun time. Equipment is in great shape.

We have a big family and when we want to get together on a nice day or have a party outside, we like to go to this nice little park. We have even enjoyed a movie there in the grass before which was really nice with some of our grandbabies. Some of the things it has is a nice play area with swings and climbing things, a great pavilion which you do not need to make any type of reservation for, basketball court and even a skate park. Lots to do in not a huge area and not as crowded as the larger park in town is.
Great park with open spaces and a great equipment play area.

name: Carson River Park
address: 5013 Carson River Rd, Carson City, NV 89701, USA
reviews: Nice open space, not a play park but lots of space and a nice picnic area.  Good place to start a decent hike to Mexican Dam

Great place to have a calm relaxing walk following the river. There are picnic tables and an area that would be good for small gatherings like a wedding ceremony. Take your dogs, kids and a lunch; this is a great day spot.
This park has a good parking area, restroom, picnic table and hiking trails. The walk to the old Mexican Dam is about 45 minutes to 1 hour, one way, on easy trails, with no elevation change.

Love this place perfect for the kids if you look hard enough you'll find a slow-moving part of the river at the beginning of the road off to your right that has a  area for the kids to play in and a Sandy Beach type area perfect for bringing out the ATVs dirt bikes good relax family environment.
Love sitting  by the water. . . Walking the trails and seeing the eagles. .  Beautiful!!

name: Eagle Valley Golf Course
address: 3999 Centennial Park Dr, Carson City, NV 89706, USA
reviews: Great, walkable course for the money, with picturesque views of the Sierra Nevada. I've played it a number of times, most recently in October 2019, and the greens and fairways were in great shape, especially for the affordable price. IF the wind isn't blowing, this is one of the easier courses you can play, and one of the only coursed I've finished 18 holes without losing a ball. However, the wind blows nearly every afternoon, which is the course's main defense. But it's worth playing in the afternoon for the cheap rates, the relatively open course, and the magnificent sunsets behind the High Sierra.

Nice course, challenging at times with the brush lining the sides of the fairways.  Still plenty of room for us hackers to find those good shots. So close to getting my first Eagle on one of the par 4's, I did make the Birdie putt.
With this weather condition, the course is really good condition and the best part of it.. we had fun!
Very nice course with beautiful views.

A wonderful local golf course and club facility. I don't golf, ( but enjoy driving the cart ). We attended a retirement part there and the faculty was great for this and the views were, of course, incredible!

name: Bodines Casino
address: 5650 S Carson St, Carson City, NV 89701, USA
reviews: Good Food & Value! , Nice Sports Bar & Lots of Tvs

BEST FOOD CAUSE THE COOK AND STAFF ARE THE BEST. You have to go here and eat. Love your food, I eat here as much as I can.  Prim rib is to die for. I'll be back next week, I plan to save room for dessert, make something great please. All your restaurant staff and especially your cooks deserve something special for being so nice making us feel like we're the only people that they have to take care of and cook for.  Thank you and thank them for me.  Know that you hired an awesome staff. Bathrooms are clean the casino is very clean.  Everyone in the casino was having fun and winning.  I would recommend you come here to eat, drink and play slots.  You'll love it

Waited an hour and a half to get our food. Had to ask for coffee 3 different times because they kept forgetting. Waitress told us they were going to comp all of our food and ended up getting half of it off. Happy for the discount, but it absolutely was not worth the experience. In general was really disappointed in the service.
Small friendly place.  Good food, good selection of gaming.  I like to stop here going to or coming from Reno to home
Such a gem. Small. Cozy. Friendly staff, good food. Not a flashy high roller casino.

name: Virginia & Truckee Railroad Company
address: 166 F St, Virginia City, NV 89440, USA
reviews: The history was explained by the great conductor with delightful clear diction. He had a wonderful since of humor. It was a little cold but was great fun too. We loved it.

We came here for the day out with Thomas the train event. It was really fun and they had lots for the kids to do. Face paint, mini golf. The train itself was really cool. They also do a Christmas train that looks like fun. The ride was interesting and just the perfect amount of time for the littles to enjoy but not get bored.
The kids loved it. Bring a jacket when it’s cool out. The train cars are open-air.

Everything was perfect. The ride the cars. Views of mines and gold depot station. Tunnels as well. The people of V&T made the trip most of all kind courteous  and the Trip was narrated by a very knowledgeable man. The period dress also made it great. This is a must do. Trip ends in Virginia City. About an hour and a half wish we had more time for poking around there. Trip back down was great as well.
Fun ride and runs past my house all day in summer!

name: Bowers Mansion
address: 4005 Bowers Mansion Rd, New Washoe City, NV 89704, USA
reviews: This is fun place to bring your family. The tour of Bowers Mansion is fun (there is a cash fee). The guide is quirky and full of knowledge. Not only can you learn about history from the museum, you can absorb it by soaking up the sun, with a bbq on the park, or a swim in the pool (there is a pool fee). -Regina

One of our favorite places to visit in the Reno/Carson City area. They're always adding to the property. Be prepared to have cash on you if you're doing the tour. The headstones for the Bower's are up a steep hill so be prepared to get a good workout if you choose to do so (that part is optional). The tour guide is great. Very beautiful property.
Always a nice, chill day at the mansion.
Great tour guide, loved her. It's a great place to spend a few hours on the weekend.

Very good tour guide but all of the furniture was donated by locals, it is not original to the mansion. Also the mansion is not original as the upper floor was removed. Interesting history and very beautiful location.

name: Thunderbird Lodge and Yacht Lake Tahoe
address: 5000 NV-28, Incline Village, NV 89451, USA
reviews: I loved this tour! I came to Tahoe for fun and sun, and the tour of Thunderbird Lodge was a happy unplanned day trip. The history of the region was fantastic and helped me understand the development of the Nevada side of the lake, and I highly recommend this for families or casual visitors of any sort!  Fascinating!

A must see! It’s definitely entertaining to hear about this man’s life story. You won’t believe what he and his pet cat used to do in his car around San Francisco. Go see this place for yourself and experience the beauty around this lodge. A place I’d visit over and over.

We celebrated our 65th birthdays with a group of long time friends. What a fabulous day and experience!!  Great walk through the lodge with an interesting history of why it was built, by whom, and things that occurred there. This was followed by an over the top ride and luncheon on the Thunderbird. Can't express more than it was beyond one of best moments we shared together.
Undiscovered gem. Tour totally worth every penny .
One of the most beautiful historic sites in our nation.

name: Slot World Casino
address: 3879 US-50 E, Carson City, NV 89701, USA
reviews: Environment is nice, one staff member very patriotic dressed, cruising around on his mobile machine, and talked to my Veteran dad like he was a movie star. Much appreciated.  Food is great, we eat there often.
We went to their restaurant for the special. It was average but the service was great.
I love going here. They recognize the people I usually go with and the cocktail servers are always on top of it. This is one of my go to gambling places.
I haven't made a bad choice yet from breakfast to dinner I'm always pleased with my food and service at Betsy's
I am not an habitual gambler, but I do enjoy the restaurant. Good, tasty food. Good and friendly table service.

name: Historic Stateline Fire Lookout
address: Kings Beach, CA 96143, USA
reviews: Great views of the whole lake. Easy 1.5 mile trail to hike. The beginning is very steep grade but it levels out on top. Easy parking at the trail head. This was first time there and would come back again for the views. There are picnic spots and benches to take a rest.

Beautiful hike. We did it up and back in about 45 minutes. Amazing views and would be suitable for a family. It gets a little steep, but since it is less than a mile one way it wasn’t a problem for anyone in our group. Went at 7 pm and had the trail to ourselves.

Steep walk if you aren't used to inclines. Beautiful views at the top. Good spots for a picnic. No restrooms. No signs at the trailhead, parked on the side of the road with everyone else and walked up the barricaded road.

Fantastic view and a relatively easy walk to the top. Look it up in advance and the start of the trail isn't signposted from the main road so you will be slightly unsure where you're going without maps.
Nice paved walk upto scenic lookout of Lake Tahoe. Easy walk with good vertical climb to get the heart going.

name: The Kit Carson Trail (Walking Tour)
address: Carson City, NV 89701, USA
reviews: Established in 1993, the Kit Carson Trail is designated by a painted BLUE LINE and the “Talking Houses” share their ninety-second narratives that provided insight and tales about the capital city and some of its more colorful personalities. You can  listen to sound effects such as horse-drawn carriages, train whistles, and John Wayne’s voice at the Krebs-Peterson house where he made his last movie, “The Shootist,” in 1976. The route also passed the home of Orion Clemens, where his brother Samuel Clemens aka Mark Twain would stay when he was in town. The tour features 60 landmarks along the trail including the former U.S. Post Office, U.S. Mint, Governor’s Mansion, and the Carson Brewing Company, home of Tahoe Beer for more than 100 Years. For a nostalgic walk down the largest historic district in Nevada make tracks for the vivid BLUE LINE that will guide your way along the 2.5-mile path of Carson City’s legacy to discover the Wild West!
Beautiful!
Unfriendly owner

name: Lake Tahoe Nevada State Park
address: NV-28, Incline Village, NV 89451, USA
reviews: First off, let me just say, WOW.. Such an amazing and beautiful body of water. The entire area is so pretty and breathtaking. I was visiting while on a business trip in Carson City and one of the locals i befriended said I HAD to come check out the scenic route around the Lake Tahoe. They were 100% correct, as it was just amazing. The water is so clear, it looks like you could just scoop it up in a cup and drink it. I could easily move out here to enjoy this view and fantastic area every day.
These moments are breathtaking.  The fam bam, the time, and a beautiful place.  The backdrop of Lake Tahoe is magnificent.  The lake is one of a kind.  One of the most beautiful places on earth.

Amazing waterfront location - just come by early to snag parking. Would also recommend checking out their entrance ten min away from the beach. There are picnic tables and walking paths through the woods. A lovely 10mi loop incorporating a section of Tahoe Rim trail and some campgrounds there as well. Hikes includes a hike up a ridge for a magnificent view of entire Tahoe lake.
One of my favorite place to rest and swim

I checked this off my bucket list and let me tell you it was worth it! 
If you decide to walk the 3 miles trail leading to Sand harbor beach, I can tell you right now, you will not be disappointed. This will be your view during your walk 😊😊. Enjoy it

name: Cave Rock - Lake Tahoe Nevada State Park
address: Hwy 28, Glenbrook, NV 89413, USA
reviews: Scenic overlooks of Lake Tahoe from the Southeast shore. Be careful though! The last part of the hike is for experts only in good physical condition. Lots of big steps AND using your hands for help. If you can make it to the top...your reward is an amazing 360 degree view. Enjoy!

Beautiful 360 degree views once you hike the short trail. There is limited parking near the entrance of the trail, so reach early. There is so much to do around the area, you could easily spend a day on the trails and the nearby beach. If you want to watch a special sunset in the area, this comes highly recommended. Attaching some sunset shots :)

Don't know where to start on this place but to summarize it in the nutshell it is short and very rewarding trail. You don't find trails like this very often it's like a gold nugget of the trail in my experience there's only few in my book trails that offer such reward. To get to the top of the rocks may not be suitable for everybody you will need to climb some rocks so older folks and younger kids might struggle here but you still will enjoy some views even if you don't climb to the top of the rock. My five-year-old daughter had no issues climbing to the top of the rocks obviously supervised. I would not attempt this if the weather is not perfect as the rocks might be slippery especially if it's snowing I would not go there.
Love this place. I come over every time I visit lake Tahoe for some peaceful time by the rocks. Parking fee started recently but it's very reasonable. The scene from here is just amazing 😍

This place is beyond gorgeous! Nature can be so impressive sometimes...
It's as enjoyable in winter than in summer!

name: Roberts House Museum
address: 1207 N Carson St, Carson City, NV 89701, USA
reviews: Small, but what a great history.
Can't really say much about it since it was closed when I went there. What I could see through the windows looked interesting.

name: Empire Ranch Golf Course
address: 1875 fairway, Carson City, NV 89701, USA
reviews: Very picturesque with fun wildlife and surrounded by beautiful mountains. Since it is winter season one course was closed due to flooding and disappointingly there are no garbage cans along the course which led to unsightly littering near the bathrooms areas. Inside restrooms were surprisingly neat with space heaters for warmth (much appreciated). Plant life made it almost impossible to find and retrieve balls a foot into traps. Despite all we do look forward to coming back and enjoying the course during peak season.
I love this course,  they are doing a great job revamping it after the flood. Twilight rates for 18 joles with a cart are only 20 bucks per person. Highly recommend

Great course, quick round, reasonable price. Bring some deep woods mosquito repellent there were tons of them we played in the morning. They are making great progress recovering this course still Al long way to go but it looks great. Great job guys keep it up!

Biking / hiking trail between this golf course and the Carson River is a mini-adventure with tall sage, willows and other growth. Saw 9 juvenile vultures and 1 juvenile eagle in a tree together. 2 vulture parents were nearby -- 1 flying and the other watching.
I received an update they are opening a par 3 course. Thank you!

name: Ambrose Carson River Natural Area
address: 281-309 N Deer Run Rd, Carson City, NV 89701, USA
reviews: The waters freezing but it might be fun to fish, saw some deer out on the river.
This is a great place to relax and explore.
I didn't spend much time there so it's hard for me to rate it.
Best Airsoft place ever
Awesome area for photos and or picnic!

name: Way It Was Museum
address: 113 C St, Virginia City, NV 89440, USA
reviews:
This was a nice way to kill a few hours in the afternoon. Most places to see are soliciting you for cocktails while waiting.

Virginia City has tons of history and much is located here.

There really was a lot of rhyme or reason for sequence of displays. But neat to see stuff that was 100+ years old.

There seems to be zero public restrooms in all of Virginia City...inclusive of here. Make sure you don't ask and use the restroom prior to admission.

Dont take American Express either...

I love Virginia city so much history of the way it was a hard life for people that had gold fever. I think all the kids should come & see true pioneers & the difficult life they had instead of email it was the pony Express.
Lots of interesting exhibits and info. Not great for kids or anyone not really interested in history, but I loved it.
A little run down from it's hey-day. Definitely has great potential but needs an update, much like Virginia City in general. The artifacts are authentic and there is a lot to learn here.

A simple but very intresting museum. Lots of little details to see and ponder over. Historical objects and the stories behind them are plentiful here.  Bonus points for a very talkative and adorable museum cat that sat behind the counter. If I ever get back to Virginia City I will be sure to go again.

name: Kings Beach State Recreation Area
address: Bear St, Kings Beach, CA 96143, USA
reviews: This is sacred land. Home to many good folk. Travelers far and wide can normally find a good spot on this open beach. And in the winter it's a beautiful out look of snow covered sand. It's a must see if you have a bucket list. And a do see if your just passing through.
Great public beach in otherwise very snobby and private north shore. Clean bathrooms, safe and shallow warm water with awesome sand. Costs to park though.
Beautiful place. Clean beach. Sandy. Barely any rubbish around. One toilet out of order.

Perfect place to stop & enjoy a picnic lunch while driving around the lake. We were here the 2nd week of September- the weather was gorgeous with daytime temperatures just hitting 70. The recreational areas are clean, have plenty of parking (especially off season) clean restrooms and the beaches were just lovely.

Beautiful little beach on North Lake Tahoe.  I've never been to Lake Tahoe before, but was surprised to find a Sandy Beach -- I was expecting rocks!  Super clean, nice facilities (parking, bathrooms, playground, basketball court, benches, picnic tables), crystal clear water, gorgeous views and right in the center of a charming town.  Great way to relax after a morning filled with hiking!

name: Mackay Mansion Museum
address: 291 S D St, Virginia City, NV 89440, USA
reviews: My sister and I came to Virginia City on a last minute whim and I can’t say enough about our Experience.  Our tour guide Dawn was so gracious and gave us an option to do an after hours paranormal tour.  It definitely did not disappoint!!  The mansion was beautifully preserved and we received a lot of paranormal activity.  The Mackay Mansion is truly haunted and I would highly recommend the tour 😊

Great tour today with Katie!  She was extremely knowledgeable.  My daughter and I enjoy the paranormal and have participated in many tours.  This was the first time we had an experience. She actually heard a voice.  Would love to do a night tour of this very haunted house.
This place is amazing! Had a super fun tour there today. Check it out if you're in town

Loved every moment in this great place. It's spooky and filled with a ton of history. The tour guide was great! He allowed us to do a mini paranormal investigation upstairs. He was very kind and told us everything about the mansion.

The historical aspect of it makes it worth it. But be careful going down the stairs, they are steep. Makes me wonder how women didn't fall to their death with their heels, dresses n corsets on. If you like history I recommend it.

name: Mt. Rose Ski Tahoe
address: 22222 Mt Rose Hwy, Reno, NV 89511, USA
reviews: We got there early. Just as they opened. The place is beautiful and well set up. We wanted to sit in the bar to watch the game but the bartender Brian told us they don’t open until 10. Turns out they opened at 9:30 so he lied. Later we were trying to order drinks and I asked for a cherry coke and he told me to go to the cafe. A nicer bartender interjected and offered to pour a coke with grenadine which was perfect but I could tell Brian wasn’t pleased. If you all get rid of this guy you’d have a perfect 10 staff. Everyone (else) was very helpful and so friendly. My son loved the snowboarding and this being our first visit, we had a wonderful time. We’ll be back. Just not looking forward to this Brian guy. Ugh!

It has been a few years since we went here.   They used to be pretty good, they have made huge progress towards great.  Fast/ excellent lifts to fairly advanced terrain, magic carpet for beginners.  Great for all skill levels.  Lift staff is clearly kept in line, polite, helpful.  We had a kid lose a ticket, no problem.  
A fabulous spot, we need to go back.

A friend told me that this was a family friendly place, perfect for first time kids.  It was perfect!  First, the price can't be beat.   I paid for 1st time lessons for 3 kids. They got a 2 hour lesson plus the snowboard and the boots. The first place I was going to take them was very expensive compared to here. In fact, I would have paid the same amount for one lesson at the other location that I paid for all 3 lessons at Mount Rose. Second,  Even though we ran late because of traffic, the staff was so pleasant, courteous, and professional. They took care of the kids and made sure that everything fit and that they had everything in place before the lesson started. And during lesson they were very patient and positive and supportive. Third, I could sit on the deck, in the sun, taking photos and videos of the kids  As they took their lessons cama road up the Hill for the 1st time, and then came down the Hill. Facilities are older and need TLC.  I would give it 5 stars but the bathrooms were filthy and interior was dark and run down.   The kid's got dressed in the car because there were no facilities for them to change and put away their clothes inside the lodge.  I would definitely recommend Mt. Rose without hesitation, and I know we will be going back.

I've lived in Reno for almost 3 years but hadn't boarded at Mt. Rose yet until today. I had an absolute blast there today! The snow was great and the variety of runs kept things interesting. I felt like their 6 person lifts ran really quickly, enabling more riding time. I will highly consider getting a season pass here next year, as it only takes about 40 min to get there from the north side of town and the parking situation there is excellent, especially if you park at the bottom of the Slide Side.

Haven't been skiing in years & it was my daughter's first time. Matt gave us our lesson. He was awesome (as were most all the employees we encountered). We had a blast, even this late in the season. The weather was beautiful & it was not crowded at all (Thursday). Will go again!!

name: Fourth Ward School Museum
address: 537 S C St, Virginia City, NV 89440, USA
reviews: Really cool place I built the Elevator Shaft

My husband and I visited this beautiful historical school this weekend. We were amazed with all the beautiful original antics we saw. Everything is set up nicely with posted history and stories to read along the way. Well worth the visit. We will stop by again next time we are in the area.

It was a great experience. The history behind the school from begin to present is just so unique.  Also had exhibits of interesting parts of the town. Mines, old switchboard, printing press, dress shop...etc. I think my husband and I spent an hour or so here, exploring all the rooms available to even the writing on the walls.
Wonderful history of the school and of the town.  Being from Missouri was also interested in the Mark Twain (Samuel Clemmons) room.  Beautiful school and very nicely restored.
This was an Interesting place with a lot of history in this old school.

name: Incline Village Crystal Bay Visitors Bureau
address: 969 Tahoe Blvd, Incline Village, NV 89451, USA
reviews: Very informative visitors center and gift shop. Plenty of help with local hikes and things to do as well as locally made items for sale. It happens to be very close to the rec center. After 3pm you're able to play disc golf (holes 3-9) from the parking lot. There is also a small bbq area with benches. Pets are welcome as long as they're leashed.

This place is a nice little stop when touring around Lake Tahoe. It could use a little help with the gift shop as their t-shirts aren't very cute and they could definitely have more of a jewelry selection and more fun stuff overall. Water is available to refill water bottles.

Short visit, obtained visitor literature from a very knowledgeable warm friendly employee. Abundant amount of literature for, what I perceived to be everything to do in this area. Visitor center very helpful with both information and kindness. She even came out to meet the pups.

Very helpful tips shared by the shop lady. She recommended that we take the visitor shuttle into Sand Harbor to a void any delayed parking wait. They have great mugs, postcards, shirts and mugs..pretty much everything you'd find at a visitor center.
Very helpful people work there. We were waiting there for a shuttle for Thunderbird estate and the place is beautiful.

name: Washoe Club Museum & Saloon
address: 112 S C St, Virginia City, NV 89440, USA
reviews: Really heartfelt tour led by people who actively care and work for The Washoe Club. Made it all the more creepy and I even got to have a weird encounter myself. The tour guide had a lot of neat inside stories and photos from past tours and just working there in general. If you only have time for one tour, this is definitely the one you should visit.

Visited here 3 yrs ago and took in the whole little city. Also decided to participate in the ‘Ghost Tour’ that was offered. It was a crazy experience. I used my phone to capture EVPs and had a few experiences that validated others findings. Upstairs, in the room with the long mirror made from Diamond Dust, I was over looking into the mirror, while the rest of the tour group was learning about different things. I remember feeling like someone was behind me and after later going through my audio footage, I caught the sound of faint cowboy boots with spurs clinking, eventually grow louder and stopping next to me. I’ve also caught poker chips clinking, as well as voices interacting. Quite the experience. Loved it. Would definitely recommend and like to go again.

Super cool place to go to in Virginia City. It's jam packed with history! The staff here are great and the tour is very spooky. Obviously famous for being on the show Ghost Adventures, but whether you are here form the haunts or for the history, it is a great place to visit.

We love this place.  I used to live in Virginia city and hang out here. And those ghost stories are real!!! Its ghost adventure heaven.  The back room where the crypt is will raise the hair on the most jaded head. And in the ladies room I swear I heard a lady humming but when I came out I was all on my onesie.  And the tour is off the chain. We heard lots of unexplained foot steps. You never knew what or who the washoe will come alive for

My sister and I came to Virginia City for a spontaneous weekend trip and thoroughly enjoyed our haunted Washoe tour with Halen.  It was very informative, spooky and he added a sense of humor that made it fun as well.  I highly recommend it!!

name: Emerald Bay State Park
address: 138 Emerald Bay Rd, South Lake Tahoe, CA 96150, USA
reviews: The family really had fun coming here. Picturesque view of the lake from top and a little island in the middle of the lake. Decent parking but I guess its gets full easily. You have to hike down to take a closer look of the lake and the sandy beach below (picture). So, you have some good exercise from hiking and all the natural wonders you get to see. What else can you ask for.

So beautiful. Love the views. You can get down on the island, on the beach, camp there, or just look from above with one of their many looking places. Very relaxing. Come here if you're coming to Tahoe. Defiantly worth the drive!

Wonderful view of Lake Tahoe and Emerald Bay. Great for all kinds of nature photo shoots. Road going there is a little narrow, ... you have to drive slowly around the bends and going up there, but it's well worth the effort. Fresh mountain air all around and it can get busy there even if the weather is colder or not so nice with the usual blue skies and sunshine. Parking was around $10 (for the whole day I think, and it's self-serve at a kiosk) but there's no other fee to hike and wander around the area. Make sure you bring a drinking water bottle and good shoes to walk around the rocks, trails, etc.

Although it is difficult to distinguish, Emerald Bay and its surroundings including Cascade Lake and Falls are the most scenic and popular part of Lake Tahoe preferred for trekking and camping. An unforgettable part of the world which was inscribed to my brain as a global trotter. Would like to go and trek again...

Gorgeous! So glad we went. We spent about an hour plus hours walking here. Very special. We got a tip to go early. That was helpful! We arrived before 9:00 on a Saturday in mid September. We were able to park. When we left, cars were circling

name: Diamond Peak Ski Resort
address: 1210 Ski Way, Incline Village, NV 89451, USA
reviews: Went here for my first snowboarding lesson with Pete and he was great. Please  ignore the website that says come an 1hr before your class. If it is during peak season and on a weekend you're going to need more like 2hrs, that is if you are getting rentals because the lines where crazy long and they even ran out of rentals by noon. Other than that it was a good time. Staff was friendly and helpful.

If you've ever been to Lake Tahoe and you love skiing this is the place for you. They have a great learning program for kids and adults. Some of the slopes give you a breathtaking view of the high mountains and the enormous lake. Me being one, I really recommend this place for tourists.

The ski school was horrible.  Very unorganized.  The person in charge of ski school was rude.  Booked my daughter for an afternoon lesson, the class started.  They told us to check her in to another class by going back into the building to re-do the check out process after we've already done it.  It's hard to walk back there, slippery and having to carry all her ski equipment that we rented.  The person in charge was not accommodating.  The instructors were pretty nice.  I had Larry for a class next day, he was good.  My daughter had Bobby G for full day class the next day and liked him.  But I would not recommend this place.

Our family used to love Diamond Peak - small, affordable, generally not crowded, and easy to navigate. However, they have ruined everything by making 2 of my family's favorite runs into jumps, so we end up doing the same run over and over again - boring and crowded. Not sure we will come back. Please bring back the runs we all loved so much for some variety. Thank you

My friends and I love this place!! We are all different level skiers, ranging from green to black, so this ski resort was perfect for everyone! The lodge was not too crowded on the day we went, so after we skied, we all hung out in the lounge and had fun by the fire. Coming here again for more winter retreats!

name: Lake Tahoe Cruises
address: 760 US-50, Zephyr Cove, NV 89488, USA
reviews:
My wife and I absolutely loved this cruise. Totally worth the cost and would recommend to others. 
I would go when the weather is nice. It gets really cold there especially if the wind is blowing on you. There are a couple things that could be improved upon. One of the speakers on the deck was really distorted sounding. It should be replaced if it hasn’t been already. The TV/video monitors that were playing a documentary about Lake Tahoe need to be updated. The quality was bad but the documentary was fascinating. 
We went for the cruise and it didn’t disappoint.
The big paddle wheel was super cool too.
Took my daughter on her first miss Dixie cruise. She loved it. Lunch on board was great. Highly recommend

Lots of fun and beautiful cruise itinerary across the lake to Emerald Bay.  We did the 3 hour dinner cruise. The food was okay, beer and wine inexpensive, mixed drinks ten bucks. The band was enjoyable.  A wonderful way to see the lake!
A great cruise that took 2.5 hours. Excellent landscapes. It covers the southern part of the lake and it is worth to try it

Great views. No rocking on the boat which was wonderful! The sunset cruise was great. Food was pretty good. I had a salad, diner rolls, salmon with mixed vegetables, and cheesecake with strawberry drizzle. I’d rate the food a 4/5. I’d do the cruise again as it was comfortable And having the food was an added plus. I wish the speakers outside were a bit louder as it was hard to hear the history of Vikingsholm with all the people on deck. Alcohol is served.

name: Lake Tahoe - East Shore Forest
address: Carson City, CA 90745, USA
reviews: Very breath taking when you get close to the lake
A must visit nd stay atleast for a night
Stunning views of lake Tahoe along a beautiful man-made walkway.

Worse than the first time I saw it in 1960. You could drink water right from the lake then. Every thing was cleaner then, not contaminated and spoiled like it is now. Money ruins all naturally beautiful things.
It's like Tahoe! It doesn't get any better

name: Chollar Mine Tour
address: 615 F St, Virginia City, NV 89440, USA
reviews: Pretty cool place. You can go into the mine for about 500 feet or so, and the guide will talk about how things worked back in the day. Virginia City is a cool place to visit, as it was once the richest town in the world, due to the gold, silver and copper mines there.

Brilliant tour! Slightly out of the way, but worth the visit. Our guide was hugely knowledgeable and clearly interested in the subject as well as keen to answer the many questions I had. The mine itself was authentic, a genuine experience which was fascinating as well as unique. Never been in a 19th century mine before, probably never will be again, but now I can say that I have. You won't be dissapointed.

First off I will say this is a great tour, I've done it 2 times now. Once when my kids were a little younger and just recently and it doesn't disappoint. The guide is very nice and informative. Whenever you are in Virginia city this tour is a must.
A place of history and culture that once thrived on gold & silver take a trip into the past, jump aboard the time machine and create some unique memories
It was a delightful step back in time, John Tyson was exceptional as a guide & a crack up.

name: Commons Beach
address: 400 N Lake Blvd, Tahoe City, CA 96145, USA
reviews: A really great park tucked away on the N shore. Just a quick walk along the boardwalk takes you to a public pier.

The beach is not a far walk from parking (on street or small designated areas). Definitely doable with kids. So many pretty sights.  The playground and restrooms are clean and well maintained.  When we were there they had free concerts going on. We will definitely return when in Lake Tahoe.
We stopped by in between ski trips on a sunny and 50 degree day.  Breathtaking view and a nice playground made for happy kids and parents alike.

Really great place to spend the time with the family. There are playground for children, the beach is so quiet to swimming and to play with surfboards, and a little trail for bikes and pedestrians. Very close there is a small pier where you can swimming as well. Highly recommended when you're travelling to Tahoe!

I don't think so, I liked a place more than this in Tahoe city. It's a beach so it's free and I can spend hours here just laying or walking around it. It offers a great view and one of the most cleanest beach that I have been so far. Kids friendly but I don't remember seeing any dogs though. 2 mins away from the beach, they organize Farmer's market every Thursday, which is an added bonus. Not very crowded, you would only see families and very safe vibe. For instance, I left my stuff unattended and found it exactly where I left.

name: Silver Terrace Cemetery
address: 381 Cemetery Rd, Virginia City, NV 89440, USA
reviews: Very clean and well kept cemetery. I was only able to view a small portion of the cemetery before I had to head to the nearby hotel to check in. I am doing my family ancestry and saw some familiar last names that are in my tree on my last visit. I'm excited to continue my research to see if I have family here and to return to view the rest of the cemetery.

One of the best historic cemeteries I've visited. Somme of the graves are a bit beat up, but most are in great condition and date mostly from the mid-late 1800s. A lot of beautiful stonework and some interesting bits of history. They have a little historical pamphlet, it's a bit sparse on details, but over all the visit was well worth it.

It was very exciting to see all the old gravestones and walk through and just filled the history around you. When they close they mean they close. We were run out of their I guess by the caretaker right at 5 o'clock on the nose but all in all it was a good time period

If you visit Virginia City NV and have the time you should visit the cemetery. It is very interesting looking at the old tombstones of the residents from long ago. There generally are will horses roaming in the area also

Cool place to check out . Tombstones from the 1800's.
Many claim its haunted..
Find out for yourselves!

name: Squaw Valley Resort
address: 1960 Squaw Valley Rd, Olympic Valley, CA 96146, USA
reviews: One of the best resorts in Tahoe. They do an amazing job with events and the programing in the village. Aaron Tippet the events manager is a top notch human. Love working with him. They have music and fireworks every Saturday. Also Laser tubing. Not to mention the skiing and boarding is world class. Eat at one of the many restaurants in the village, my favorite is the Nectar spot, the wraps are DELICIOUS. Be sure to take a ride in the tram and head up to high camp. While you're there check out the Olympic museum or grab some food.

Great skiing at Squaw valley! Beautiful mountain, lots of parking, tons of shops, restaurants a d bars at the base. Add to that a giant mountain with a wide range of skiing choices from pleasant groomed cruising to crazy steep, through the trees powder skiing. Nice lifts and gondolas. Well maintained and clean. A+ experience!

There wasn't a ton of snow, but Squaw was still a blast. The runs are super fun and well maintained. There's a wide range of accessibility from easy to super challenging. Also, everyone working there was super friendly, from Ski patrol, to information, to the lift operators. I feel like it's a little confusing to find the entrance from the main ski lot, but if you just keep trekking through the village, you'll find the base. Can't wait to come back when there's fresh snow and I can hit the trees!

This is one of my favorite resorts in Tahoe. They have a ton of variety in their runs and it's a big resort so I can come multiple days in a row and not do the same runs over and over. If you haven't tried the cookies it's definitely a must for the end of a long snow day!

Squaw is huge! It's great for all skill levels. I go on blues and there were super long stretches with pretty short lines at the lifts. I also have beginner and advanced level friends who all enjoyed the resort. Squaw village also feels very cozy.

name: Saint Mary In the Mountains
address: 111 E St, Virginia City, NV 89440, USA
reviews: It was beautiful!! A wonderful museum in the basement. The gentleman was so very kind and informative. Thank you 😊 the inside is breathtaking.
Exquisite design and beautiful architecture. I love this place. It's a must see.

Disclaimer: we did not attend service, only attended the museum and saw the sanctuary.

A pretty building with a wonderful history. The museum is full of artifacts from over the years, including information on Father (Bishop) Manongue— a local celebrity of sorts.

However, it could be much more well kept and the people working there could afford to be much nicer. My husband spotted a restroom and used it, but was accosted (at length) by a woman working for the church after doing so. It made a poor impression at the very least.
This is a beautiful Catholic Church up here in Virginia City! :-) it is a must see if you come to Virginia City even if you're not of the Catholic denomination! :-)

So much more than a church. It's special. Every time I come to Nevada I have to stop here and say a prayer and give a blessing. This church in more than just a local church. You have people coming from across this country to stop here and visit. You don't have that in Reno or Carson City. But St. Mary in the Mountains in Virginia City is special.

name: Incline Village Recreation Center
address: 980 Incline Way, Incline Village, NV 89451, USA
reviews:
Whenever we are in town we stop here for a workout. The locals are somewhat tolerant of our sporadic drop-ins. 

My father has a cabin here so I think we are supposed to get some kind of local discount but it never pans out which is annoying. We usually buy a family pass for the week which is super reasonable.

I love the basketball court and shooting around before I lift weights. 

The warm indoor pool for laps and fooling around with the kids is a great way to get out of a snowbound cabin and get some fun family exercise. 

I’m always perplexed at well funded fitness facilities of this size that have a tiny weight area and don’t have barbells. The facility is huge but they cram the hamster wheels and weights into a closet sized area. It’s a 1970’s health club model. The cardio/weight room is the most utilized area but it gets the least space. The entrance lobby is bigger than the gym. It would be nice to get with the times and trends and expand this space to accommodate the demand.
Best of Incline- swim, workout, etc

I visited the rec center for the first time today and I was blown away. Not only is it well laid out with just about anything and everything you could want for exercise it was sparkling clean with nice lounging areas. The staff was amazing. Kathy gladly  answered all my questions and pointed out some helpful literature to take with me. Also got to talk with the childcare people about my 2 grandson's coming possibly in March and I just loved every minute of it. I tell you the people who live in Incline Village that have the IVGID residence pass really have something special.
Nice and clean. During work days they open dive jumping for everybody including little ones.
Great pool

name: Genoa Courthouse Museum
address: 2304 Main St, Genoa, NV 89411, USA
reviews: Amazing museum! Our favorite was learning more about Snowshoe Thompson and how he ate beef jerky, crackers and melted snow while delivering mail. Staff was very kind and shared fun facts about George Ferris who invented the ferris wheel and lived in Carson City.
Interesting, clean, and very friendly staff! They have a small  area to purchase a nice selection of books.
Nice museum with friendly staff. Very reasonable admission.
What a great place to explore the history of Genoa, I highly recommend a stop here if you're coming through here.
Especially liked info on first Ferris wheel

name: Mormon Station State Park
address: 2295 Main St, Genoa, NV 89411, USA
reviews: My dog loves coming here on the way home. It's quiet, off the street and lots of grass. A public restroom that is clean and a water dish for the dogs.
One of my favorite places to go and spend an afternoon walking and looking at the shops. And walking through this beautiful grassy area

We try to come out here to Genoa every year for the annual Candy Dance. It's a big craft fair where you can see a huge variety of vendors. There are also food vendors and little grassy areas to sit and eat. I love going.
It was interesting. Lots to look at for $1. Picnic tables so you can have a picnic on a nice day

Educational stop with old west items and the history of Nevada. Make sure you check out the Snowshoe Thompson statue and story in front.  Head across the street to learn more about the Candy Dance founder too!

name: Bowl Incline
address: 920 Southwood Blvd, Incline Village, NV 89451, USA
reviews: I love stepping back in time at the old school bowling alleys. Incline Bowl does it right -- it's clean and fun for the kids and the drinks are poured well for the adults. Nice pool tables and a few arcade games as well. It can get crazy busy here, but the employees work hard and will take care of ya!

Right in the heart of Incline Village, the bowling joint is the perfect getaway for some good fun activity. Prices are reasonable and if you come here late in the evening (except Friday & Saturday) you're sure to get a lane. Location has ample parking.

They have a small arcade area, a Pro Shop and an over 21 billiard with a bar but no snack shop (unless you count the vending machine with cup of noodles).
Loved it! All the way from Spain I had a great time!
Good, classic fun. Moderately vintage. Great place to unwind with the family,  or your crew.

Neat bowling alley. Cool little arcade. Kids loved it. Bar tender was friendly and the woman running the bowling area was super friendly. Very old school look and feel, but we had a good time playing a game or two!

name: Basil
address: 311 N Carson St, Carson City, NV 89701, USA
reviews: This was one of the best Thai restaurants I've ever been to! Great service, delicious food, reasonably priced. I would recommend this as a drive for people even living in Reno, it's THAT good!

Absolutely fabulous food. Super fresh, incredible flavors. The restaurant is very clean and well kept. The head chef greeted us and was an excellent hostess. I definitely recommend eating here, it's an authentic Thai experience not to be missed!

This is a gem and nice surprise for Carson city! What truly amazed me is they have authentic Thai decoration with meticulous details throughout the place. The amount of effort they put into the authentic decor is amazing. They even have fresh rose pedals in the water they same way you will fins it in Thailand. But consider their location is in remote Carson city!

Food is in very good quality and fresh within a large collection, unlike other mediocre Thai restaurants.

This place should get 25 star reviews because it is that excellent! The food is the best Thai food I’ve ever had, the service is exceptional and the owners are involved in the restaurant by talking to customers and one of the owners is the cook. This place is a must try if you live her or if you’re just passing through!

Thank you for such great food and awesome service you guys are the best!

This place is fantastic! I never expected to find such authentic Thai food in Carson City. Just the exact right balance of sweet and salty and spicy, you can tell the chef really puts love into everything. The duck skin was crispy, the vegetables were fresh, the food was perfectly flavoured and the staff were absolutely lovely with great service. Generous portion sizes, reasonable prices, beautiful atmosphere, I highly recommend this place.

name: Glen Eagles
address: 3700 N Carson St, Carson City, NV 89706, USA
reviews: Absolute beautiful atmosphere with both decor and mood. Beautiful place settings, wonderfully professional, personal, and informative staff. 5 star food and amazing selection of fancy desserts. Even a beautiful piece of cheesecake for my birthday. Absolutely wonderful, special place to celebrate. Thank you.

Service was excellent, and that is the only reason for the 2 stars. I took my wife there last night for her birthday dinner. It was our first visit and we were excited based on the reviews. However, we were left disappointed,  my wife's steak was rare, but ordered as med-well. My steak tasted like it fell on the charcoal and was then dunked in crisco. Neither of us finished our steaks, or anything else on the plate., my rice pilaf was under cooked with crunchy pieces of rice. The baked potato was poor, I have had better baked potatoes from Wendy's.  The onion rings were okay, they would have been great except for the excess oil, way to greasy. We left and went home hungry. At over $100 for 2 dinners and 1 Margarita & 1 soda. I would say save your $....

I just read the "response from the owner" Wow, my name is not Darren - not hard to see that in the original post. That helps to show the attention to detail that is lacking here. After talking with several friends I have been informed that this is actually very common, apparently the quality of the food is either off the charts awesome - or off the charts poor. We know what my experience was, I hope others experiences are better.

Great service, great food. Had Chilean sea bass and peppercorn NY steak, both cooked to perfection. Topped off with Italian lemon cream cake and really good coffee. Perfect dinner for our birthday celebration!
My cohort and I were in Carson City for training & stumbled upon this lovely place. We were pleasantly served by Cindy & amused by Bonnie. Both were a delight and the food was wonderful.

Very nice atmosphere. Quality food with a nice menu to choose from. Generous portions, you will not be hungry afterwards.  Our server was very good and was knowledgeable about menus items and the specials. I would recommend reservations for larger parties and on weekends.

name: Villa Basque Café
address: 730 Basque Way, Carson City, NV 89706, USA
reviews:
My first visit here and it was a great start.  It was busy but service was prompt and our sandwiches came out quickly. 

A good number of options on the menu for breakfast or lunch.  The chorizo is the focus and it's amazing. 

This is a great spot.

Had an amazing burrito and mocha here! Had fasted for 24 hours and just one dish hit all the spots and left me full as heck! The service was awesome and the recommendations were on point. Highly recommend!

Wonderful food with a small town feel. You will feel right at home. Portions are large, service is quick and the food is full of flavor. Try the gravy! Highly recommend.. you will not be disappointed.
What an amazing and homey place, wish i could come here more often. The owner is incredible and the food is as well!
Food is great here. The chorizo is a must try. Both dishes we tried has chorizo in them.

name: Red's Old 395 Grill
address: 1055 S Carson St, Carson City, NV 89701, USA
reviews: Great food, great drinks and great atmosphere - loved all the items hanging on the walls and from the ceilings - we happened to visit on a Saturday night and there was a magician visiting tables doing card tricks - very entertaining . . .
